text: is a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Minagawa was born in Tokyo on October 9, 1991. After graduating from Chuo University, he joined J1 League club Sanfrecce Hiroshima in 2014. He played many matches as substitute forward from his first season. In 2018, he moved to J2 League club Roasso Kumamoto on loan. He played as a regular player and scored 11 goals. In 2019, he returned to Hiroshima. However he could hardly play in the match. In July 2019, he moved to J2 club Yokohama FC. He played many matches and Yokohama was promoted to J1 from 2020. In 2021, he moved to Vegalta Sendai. On September 5, 2014, Minagawa debuted for the Japan national team against Uruguay. ==Statistics== ===Club statistics=== Updated to 17 December 2022.Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑ハンディ版 2018 (NSK MOOK)", 7 February 2018, Japan, (p. 235 out of 289)Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "2016J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑", 10 February 2016, Japan, (p. 13 out of 289)Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑 2014 (NSK MOOK)", 14 February 2014, Japan, (p. 15 out of 290) Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup League Cup League Cup Continental Continental Other Other Total Total Total Season Club League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Japan Japan Japan League League Emperor's Cup Emperor's Cup League Cup League Cup Asia Asia Other1 Other1 Total Total 2014 Sanfrecce Hiroshima J1 League 18 3 3 2 3 0 1 0 0 0 25 5 2015 5 0 3 3 3 0 – 3 1 14 4 2016 19 2 2 0 1 1 6 1 0 0 22 3 2017 18 1 1 1 4 0 – – 23 2 Total 60 6 9 6 11 1 7 1 3 1 84 14 2018 Roasso Kumamoto (loan) J2 League 41 11 0 0 – – – 41 11 Total 41 11 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 41 11 2019 Yokohama FC J2 League 16 1 0 0 – – – 16 1 2020 J1 League 29 3 – 0 0 – – 29 3 Total 45 4 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 45 4 2021 Vegalta Sendai J1 League 15 0 1 0 6 1 – – 22 1 2022 J2 League 33 5 2 0 – – – 35 5 Total 48 5 3 0 6 1 0 0 0 0 57 6 Career total 194 26 12 6 17 2 7 1 3 1 227 35 ===International statistics=== Japan National Football Team Database Japan national team Japan national team Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2014 1 0 Total 1 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Tokyo Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:J1 League players Category:J2 League players Category:Sanfrecce Hiroshima players Category:Roasso Kumamoto players Category:Yokohama FC players Category:Vegalta Sendai players
